website_summaries.verdict: Beyond waterproof functionality, this model has good all-around photographic capabilities out of the water.
pros: Offers optical zoom lens that helps a lot with still image photographs
Includes 16 megapixels of image resolution for photos
cons: Higher price than some others on our list
Limited to full HD video recording

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera durable and works great underwater
customer_reviews.text: Third finepix. Travel all over in all weather conditions and used while doing all my outdoor activities inluding hiking, biking, ziplines, snorkeling and diving. Camera keeps up with me and allows downloads to my iphone and ipad.
customer_reviews.author: tekman

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!!!
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work in the swimming pool! We bought this specifically for a trip to Thailand and it leaked the first time we used it. We weren’t able to get any pictures of all the beautiful underwater corals or fish.
customer_reviews.author: gesche johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: What a fabulous little camera! It's been to Grand Cayman and Costa Rica in the last few months and has taken great pics! Thsnk goodness for the bright color - it slipped away as soon as i went to snorkel in a rough area and the color made it easy to spot and grab before it went to the ocean floor. The transfer process is easy using the app downloaded to your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've rented this camera before so I knew it would be reliable and rugged and take good pictures. Tested the camera at 15 feet in fresh water and no problems. Picture quality was good and at that depth light was bright so not surprising. This is not a high end underwater camera and should not be expected to perform like one. At the price point this is without doubt a excellant buy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Cicchini

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, first day I took it on vacation and underwater, it leaked and was NOT waterproof. Unable to use it the rest of my vacation.
customer_reviews.author: DutchinTexas

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This camera works really well for taking under-water pictures during snorkeling or snubaing. It takes good quality photos both above and below water. And it is durable. We have 2 of them and take both of them on our trips!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren St. Onge

customer_reviews.title: Not new!!!
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished even though it states it is new. Not honest and for 30$ more you can actually get a new one
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Floisand

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Took in water once and it broke, noticed after the seal had a rip in it.
customer_reviews.author: PhilD

customer_reviews.title: As expected!
customer_reviews.text: This camera works well as expected. Tested waterproof in the bathtub. Clearance of pictures is OK and sr auto seems to capture the appropriate mode. Generally, I am satisfied with the camera. Good purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Byungkyu Kim

customer_reviews.title: the camera would have been a great product, but the one i recieved was not in working condition,
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately the camera would not hold a charge and therefor did not operate after the time it was plugged in. So I was not able use the camera for my vacation
customer_reviews.author: Soma

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my wife and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Angeleri

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very affordable for someone who doesn't dive often!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my dive in St. Maarten. Colors could be better, but for the money it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Luck

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this particular camera out doors yet but I did use it in my sink! I completely submerged it and snapped this shot while the faucet was running, to get the bubbles. Pretty clear! Camera seems heavy duty and well made. Easy to use. Can’t wait to get to San Diego and go snorkeling with the leopard sharks!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Poor flash
customer_reviews.text: The camera has a good feel initially. The T and W controls are not well placed and require two hands in some situations to protect from dropping the camera. I've used the camera for a couple months now and work in dark areas at time so needed a good flash. This ain't it. My old XP-45 had a much better flash. I often need to take several shots to find a usable one because the flash does not light up a space well. Appears to be weak and to have short range. Very disappointing. Photos in good light are fine and very usable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce P.

customer_reviews.title: Iv had this for 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 years and it is 100% worth the price. It’s shock proof freeze proof and water proof, and sand proof. I have taken it under water, sledding in freezing temperatures, sand dunes in the desert, and dropped it accidentally at high points. The photos aren’t clear as day, but definitely good quality. If you really want amazing quality though, get a Nikon camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fujifilm FinePix XP120 Digital Camera
product_meta.description: A sleek yet rugged point-and-shoot, the Fujifilm FinePix XP120 is a capable, compact camera offering versatile imaging capabilities, wireless sharing, and a robust water, shock, freeze, and dustproof construction. Utilizing a 16.4MP CMOS sensor, this camera can record high-resolution stills at up to 10 fps and Full HD 1080p video, and the sensor's back-illuminated design maintains smooth, low noise image quality when working in difficult lighting conditions. Complementing the imaging assets is a Fujinon 5x optical zoom lens that covers a 28-140mm equivalent focal length range for working in a variety of scenarios, and optical image stabilization minimizes the appearance of camera shake for sharper handheld shooting.In addition to straight photos and movies, the XP120 also enables creating Cinemagraphs, where a still photo contains select moving elements for a unique multimedia image. Time-Lapse Movies can also be produced in-camera, as well as wide-format panoramas and other creative effects. The sleek form factor incorporates a 3.0" 920k-dot LCD for image review and composition, and built-in Wi-Fi is also featured for wirelessly sharing your work to a smartphone or tablet, or for remotely controlling the camera from your device.
feature_bullets: 16.4MP BSI CMOS Sensor Fujinon 5x Optical Zoom Lens
28-140mm (35mm Equivalent) Water, Shock, Freeze, and Dustproof
Full HD 1080p Video Recording at 60 fps 3.0" 920k-Dot LCD Monitor
Built-In Wi-Fi Connectivity 10 fps Continuous Shooting

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars30 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
